BasicDescription.Title: Despatch Box
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Political discussion analysing the day's events in Parliament.

BasicDescription.Title: Ever Wondered?
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. How does your environment affect you? Singer and song-writer Terry Hall tests his expectations of city versus country life.

BasicDescription.Title: Personal Passions: Germaine Greer
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Germaine Greer introduces Peter Curran to the intriguing world of scholarship, as she hunts for manuscripts from an early English female poet.

BasicDescription.Title: Ever Wondered?
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Dr Mark Porter explores the latest breakthroughs in DNA detection, while Alice Beer looks at the growing phenomenon of women writing and reading crime fiction.

BasicDescription.Title: Glasgow 1998 - Supporting The Arts
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. How, and why, Glasgow set about cultivating a reputation as a centre for the arts during the 1990s.

BasicDescription.Title: Study Ireland: Citizenship 2000
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Secondary Schools. A series emphasising the duties, responsibilities and rights that young people from all over the UK have as citizens, encouraging them to become involved in their local communities.

BasicDescription.Title: Work Talk 2
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Languages. France: Essential language basics for working in France.

BasicDescription.Title: Working For Yourself
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Has The Dot.Com Bubble Burst? Tom Mangold investigates how ordinary investors became millionaires overnight in 2000, and in a new update we find out what happened to some of them.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Of The Dragon
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Mainland China's economy is booming and once again it's Shanghai which is the gateway for investors.

BasicDescription.Title: Looking At What Happens In Hospital
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Exploring the different meanings ward layouts and post-operative ward rounds, hold for patients and staff.

BasicDescription.Title: Rotten Ralph
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Talent Contest: It's talent contest time and when Ralph discovers the winning prize is a trip to Pleasure World, he's determined Sarah should win. But being rotten doesn't always pay off.

BasicDescription.Title: The Raccoons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Prism Of Zenda: More adventures from the Evergreen Forest with Bert and Melissa Raccoon and best friend Cedric Sneer, the son of awful aardvark, Cyril Sneer.

BasicDescription.Title: Woody Woodpecker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Aunt Pecky/Terror Tots/Carny Con: More spooky nonsense and fun with Woody and his pals Wally Walrus, Buzz Buzzard, Chilly Willy and Winnie Woodpecker.

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Catch up with the latest juicy gossip and insider info from the Fame Academy.

BasicDescription.Title: Blue Peter
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Magazine programme with reports from across the UK and the world, celebrity guests, music, sport, food, and a whole lot more. With Matt Baker, Konnie Huq, Liz Barker and Simon Thomas.

BasicDescription.Title: The Wayne Manifesto
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The Harder They Fall: Dad sees Charlene's sweet sixteen birthday party as a way of making amends with property developer, Tony Sartori.

BasicDescription.Title: Clifford The Big Red Dog
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Birdwell Island: This flashback episode tells the story of when the Howards moved to Birdwell Island. The town is full of preconceived ideas about how a big dog can mean big problems.

BasicDescription.Title: Ethelbert The Tiger
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Ethelbert And The Rhinoceros/Etherlbert And The Meerkats: Ethelbert tries to cheer up a sad Rhinoceros. Then, a colony of Meerkats show Ethelbert why they do everything as a team.

BasicDescription.Title: Adventures Of Spot
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Spot's First Picnic: Spot is an adventurous young dog who enjoys exploring his home and surroundings with family and friends. Today, Spot and his friends go on a picnic.

BasicDescription.Title: Fimbles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Hairbrush: What do you get if you cross a hairbrush and a hedgehog? Find out when Florrie finds a hairbrush and Pom thinks it's a 'hair-hog'! W/S. Then, Teletubbies Count To Christmas.

BasicDescription.Title: Pingu
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Pingu And The Game Of Fish: Another adventure with that lovable and sometimes misunderstood little penguin, Pingu.

BasicDescription.Title: Tweenies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Strings: Bella, Fizz, Milo and Jake find out about stringed instruments and make music pictures.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Audio: A Tweenies Christmas CD

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Rickshaw: The Teletubbies dance a walking dance, then they stop to watch a group of children who are riding on a rickshaw. Meanwhile, back in Teletubbyland Po is riding her scooter.

BasicDescription.Title: Birthdays
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Will your birthday card be among today's colourful selection?

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Primary History
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Tudor Life. Children, A Girl's Story: From paintings, statues, drawings, written records, and museums, Zig Zag discovers the different lives of rich and poor children in Tudor times.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Let's Write A Story
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Master Story Teller. Programme 3: Danny is running out of time to finish his story. When he causes an argument between his parents, Danny finally comes up with the ending to his story.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: The Experimenter
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Changes In Materials. Mending A Monster: At the funfair XP accidentally breaks a model monster. So he sets out to make a new monster and tries out all different kinds of materials.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Primary Geography
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Postcards. Distant Localities, Pakistan: This programme uses an illustrated postcard to look at aspects of life in Pakistan, in bite sized clips.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Primary Geography
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Postcards. World Environmental Change: This programme uses an illustrated postcard to look at the North Sea, and the drylands of Colorado in America, in bite sized clips.

BasicDescription.Title: Working Lunch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Business, consumer and workplace news from the award-winning team who tell it like it is. With Adrian Chiles, Adam Shaw and roving reporter Rob Pittam.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The remaining third round matches get underway this afternoon in York. Hazel Irvine introduces live coverage, and is joined by former champions, Steve Davis and John Parrott.

BasicDescription.Title: Westminster Live
BasicDescription.Synopsis: An update on the day's events in Parliament, plus your chance to question the politicians. Phone 0345 514614 [local rate], fax 020 7973 6283 [national rate], or email west.live@bbc.co.uk.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC. Followed by regional news and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Hazel Irvine, Steve Davis and John Parrott present coverage from the third round of the UK Championship, the second biggest ranking event on the snooker calendar.

BasicDescription.Title: The Weakest Link USA
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Nine American contestants play as a team, but only one will survive to reach the prize. Who will make it through the questions and survive Anne Robinson's barbed comments?

BasicDescription.Title: The Simpsons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Homerpalooza: Realising that he's out of touch with the times, Homer takes Bart and Lisa to a rock festival and finds himself hired as a freakish sideshow act.

BasicDescription.Title: TOTP2
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Join Steve Wright for his weekly trawl through the dustbins of pop history. Tonight, a special edition with the diva of all divas, Celine Dion, who introduces her hits exclusively for TOTP2.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: Top of the Pops 1964-2002, Jeff Simpson, pbk

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Quarter final places are up for grabs in the �615,000 UK Championship. Introduced by Ray Stubbs, with commentary from Clive Everton, Dennis Taylor, Willie Thorne, Ray Edmonds and Terry Griffiths.

BasicDescription.Title: The Good Life
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Suit Yourself: It's surprising what you can do with nettles and wool... Classic comedy starring Richard Briars, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Audio: The Good Life Audio-Cassette

BasicDescription.Title: Home Front
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Muswell Hill: A vegetable proves the inspiration for an art-deco garden, and MDF makes a surprise appearance in the kitchen, as Laurence and Diarmuid create a new home for Londoner Abi Newel.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: Home Front Inside Out

BasicDescription.Title: Tomorrow La Scala!
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A troupe of opera singers try to revive their careers by staging a production of Sweeney Todd at a maximum security prison. Strong language, violence and sexual content. W/S. [2002]

BasicDescription.Title: Newsnight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In-depth investigation and analysis of the stories behind the day's headlines.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Ray Stubbs wraps up the day's play in York, where the quarter final line-up is now complete. With commentary from Clive Everton, Dennis Taylor, Willie Thorne, Ray Edmonds and Terry Griffiths.
